intro: Hyptis conspersa, commonly known as hairy hyptis, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. Hyptis conspersa is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
